sentences.english: Fixed broken texture for carthaginian academy, so it should now be visible.
sentences.chinese: 修正迦太基人學院的結構，現在能看見了。

sentences.english: The Carthaginian peace of Versailles had by then poisoned everything.
sentences.chinese: 凡爾賽的迦太基和平毒害了每個人。

sentences.english: Smith was arrested and put in jail in Carthage, Illinois.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯被捕，並關進了伊利諾斯州迦太基的監獄。

sentences.english: Historically, a Carthaginian citizen phalanx was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 在歷史上，迦太基公民方陣是低質素的。

sentences.english: Rome pushed the Carthaginians from Sicily.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬先將迦太基人趕出西西里島。

sentences.english: The Carthaginians defending the city were attacked by three Roman legions.
sentences.chinese: 守城的迦太基人遭到三支羅馬軍團的襲擊。

sentences.english: The Carthaginians and Numidians had shown themselves to be good warriors as well.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基人和努米底亞人也是優秀的戰士。

sentences.english: The Carthage ran as steady as a moving sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基號平穩地前進着像移動的人行道。

sentences.english: An example fromantiquity of the use of mercenary troopsis the Carthaginians.
sentences.chinese: 一個使用僱傭兵的來自古代的例子就是迦太基人。

sentences.english: By 241 B. C. they had driven the Carthaginians out of Sicily.
sentences.chinese: 到公元前241年，他們已把迦太基人趕出西西里。

sentences.english: Out the portholes, Europe slipped over the horizon and the Carthage hit open water.
sentences.chinese: 舷窗外，迦太基號撥開水浪，歐洲逐漸消失在地平線。

sentences.english: With its destruction carthaginian civilization fell into oblivion in the history.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基則隨着它的滅亡，文明也湮沒於歷史長河之中。

sentences.english: Actually the western portion of Sicily remained under Carthaginian control.
sentences.chinese: 實際上西西里的西部依然在迦太基的控制之下。

sentences.english: He is welcomed by Dido , queen of Carthage, to whom he tells his adventures.
sentences.chinese: 他表示歡迎蒂朵女王迦太基人，他告訴他的冒險。

sentences.english: Carthaginian general, one of the great military leaders of antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基人，古代最偉大的軍事統帥之一。

sentences.english: Babylon has no ideal; Carthage has no ideal.
sentences.chinese: 巴比倫沒有理想，迦太基也沒有。

definition: the three Punic Wars (264-146 BC) between Rome and Carthage

pinyin: Ya4 li4 shan1 da4 Da4 di4

definition: Syracuse, Sicily/also written 錫拉庫薩|锡拉库萨[Xi1 la1 ku4 sa4]
Thebes, place name in ancient Egypt/Thebes, ancient Greek city state
